comments.raw_text:
This bug is for converting the verbose way of showing the tests in the [raptor perfdocs page](https://firefox-source-docs.mozilla.org/testing/perfdocs/raptor.html) into a list of tests.

For instance, the desktop suite would become:
```
Desktop

Tests for page-load performance.

* Browsertime amazon
* Browsertime bing-search
* ...
```

Note how the descriptions are not inserted. We will be able to make use of the changes made in this bug: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1637058

Instead of returning a section with a header we would do the following (which builds a list):
```
return ["* " + title]
```

Hi Myeongjun :)

Yes all descriptions will be removed from the page with this change and that's expected. So you should change this line: https://searchfox.org/mozilla-central/rev/7dafc35406b9c945189c617d427f5458933fd3fb/tools/lint/perfdocs/framework_gatherers.py#174

You can update the suite-level description (i.e. for desktop) though to include more information about the tests that are listed, that would be useful.

The next step in this work (after this bug) will be to expose these descriptions in a less verbose way. I'm wondering if sphinx (what we build our docs with) has something like a tooltip option - then people could hover over the test in the list and get more information about it that way.

Would you have any ideas/thoughts on how we could easily expose the descriptions without being too verbose?
